intro: Correa lawrenciana, commonly known as the mountain correa, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its attractive, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in well-drained conditions. It is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, where it adapts to varying climates. Its foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, white pubescence.
